root.message: The STAT_CONC_DEF field for indicator 6-1-1, translated into all languages

languages.language:
Proportion of population using safely managed drinking water services is measured by the proportion of households using an improved basic drinking water source which is located on premises (within the dwelling, yard, or plot), or available when needed. ‘Improved’ drinking water sources include: piped water into dwelling, yard or plot; public taps or standpipes; boreholes or tube wells; protected dug wells; protected springs; packaged water; delivered water; rainwater and bottled water/bought water.

Drinking water is defined as water used for ingestion, food preparation, and basic hygiene purposes.
